timeline.bodyText:
quote your variables; prefer "${var}" over "$var".
(i borrowed this from from https://google.github.io/styleguide/shellguide.html#s5.7-quoting)
timeline.author: findepi
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,27 @@
+#!/bin/bash
+
+set -xeuo pipefail
+trap "exit" INT
+
+maven="${BASH_SOURCE%/*/*}/../mvnw"
+last_n_versions=20
+
+$maven -version

timeline.bodyText:
instead of skipping modernizer, use -Dair.check.skip-all=true
perhaps -Dmaven.javadoc.skip=true -Dmaven.source.skip=true can speed things up a little bit
timeline.author: findepi
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,27 @@
+#!/bin/bash
+
+set -xeuo pipefail
+trap "exit" INT
+
+maven="${BASH_SOURCE%/*/*}/../mvnw"
+last_n_versions=20
+
+$maven -version
+
+current_version=$($maven help:evaluate -Dexpression=project.version -q -DforceStdout)
+previous_released_version=$((${current_version%-SNAPSHOT}-1))
+first_tested_version=$((previous_released_version-last_n_versions))
+
+echo "Current version: $current_version"
+echo "Testing versions from $first_tested_version to $previous_released_version"
+
+versions=$(seq "$first_tested_version" "$previous_released_version")
+
+exit_code=0
+
+for version in ${versions[*]}; do
+    PRESTO_JDBC_VERSION="${version}" time $maven -B -pl 'presto-test-jdbc-compatibility' -Ddep.presto-jdbc-under-test="${version}" -Dmodernizer.skip=true clean test || exit_code=1

+#!/bin/bash
+
+set -xeuo pipefail
+trap "exit" INT
+
+maven="${BASH_SOURCE%/*/*}/../mvnw"
+last_n_versions=20
+
+$maven -version
+
+current_version=$($maven help:evaluate -Dexpression=project.version -q -DforceStdout)
+previous_released_version=$((${current_version%-SNAPSHOT}-1))
+first_tested_version=$((previous_released_version-last_n_versions))
+
+echo "Current version: $current_version"
+echo "Testing versions from $first_tested_version to $previous_released_version"
+
+versions=$(seq "$first_tested_version" "$previous_released_version")
+
+exit_code=0
+
+for version in ${versions[*]}; do
+    PRESTO_JDBC_VERSION="${version}" time $maven -B -pl 'presto-test-jdbc-compatibility' -Ddep.presto-jdbc-under-test="${version}" -Dmodernizer.skip=true clean test || exit_code=1
+done
+
+echo "$0: exiting with ${exit_code}"

timeline.bodyText: params -> parameters

timeline.bodyText:
introduce a new interface that throws SQLException and use it in assertQueryResultEquals instead of Function
this way TestJdbcCompatibility::getSingleElementAsTimestamp will be replaced with ResultSet::getTimestamp.
Like io.prestosql.plugin.jdbc.ObjectReadFunction.ObjectReadFunctionImplementation
timeline.author: findepi

timeline.bodyText: testSelectTimestamp
timeline.author: findepi

replies.author: findepi

timeline.bodyText: testSelectTimestampWithTimeZone
timeline.author: findepi

timeline.bodyText:
Also, besides ResultSet::getTimestamp we could also test ResultSet::getObject.
See io.prestosql.jdbc.TestJdbcResultSet#testObjectTypes how this can be structured.
This would remove need for *AsSqlTimestamp test methods and make all this a bit more concise.
timeline.author: findepi

timeline.bodyText:
Use timestamp in the past, unless you want to test handling of future datetimes.
Future things can change (subject to tz data changes in the future, eg politics).
Past (but >=1970) dates are easier to reason about.
timeline.author: findepi

timeline.bodyText:
All drivers allow setting session properties.
Do you mean some particular properties here?
timeline.author: findepi

replies.bodyText:
I'm setting session properties via connection uri and in old drivers:
Caused by: java.sql.SQLException: Unrecognized connection property 'sessionProperties'
replies.author: wendigo

replies.bodyText: It's supported since 330.
replies.author: wendigo

runConnection -> useConnection (following JDBI naming here)
params -> connectionParameters
make consumer go after parameters (it's logically after)

timeline.bodyText:
maybe let's hardcode the version where this was added, instead of having this exception-driven
(what if the code in the try clause, which does a bunch of different things, starts to fail for some reason?)
timeline.author: findepi

timeline.bodyText:
I think we should pin the first tested version. I am aware this adds testing time as we do new releases, so we may want to make test matrix sparse.
I propose we start testing at say 312, and test every third release.
When this becomes too long, we will test old versions more sparsely / coarsely.
@electrum @martint what would you think?
timeline.author: findepi

+#!/bin/bash
+
+set -xeuo pipefail
+trap "exit" INT # allows to terminate script on ctrl+c instead of terminating single mvnw execution
+
+maven="${BASH_SOURCE%/*}/../../mvnw"
+MAVEN_RUN_TESTS="${maven} clean test -Dair.check.skip-all=true -Dmaven.javadoc.skip=true -Dmaven.source.skip=true -B -pl presto-test-jdbc-compatibility"
+
+"${maven}" -version
+
+current_version=$(${maven} help:evaluate -Dexpression=project.version -q -DforceStdout)
+previous_released_version=$((${current_version%-SNAPSHOT}-1))
+first_tested_version=312
+
+echo "Current version: ${current_version}"
+echo "Testing every 3rd version between ${first_tested_version} and ${previous_released_version}"
+
+versions=$(seq "${first_tested_version}" "${previous_released_version}")
+
+exit_code=0
+failed_versions=()
+
+for version in ${versions[*]}; do
+    # Test every third version
+    if ! (( $version % 3 )); then
+        if ! PRESTO_JDBC_VERSION="${version}" time ${MAVEN_RUN_TESTS} -Ddep.presto-jdbc-under-test="${version}"; then

timeline.bodyText:
Why not just?

  
    
      
        Suggested change

timeline.author: findepi
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,34 @@
+#!/bin/bash
+
+set -xeuo pipefail
+trap "exit" INT # allows to terminate script on ctrl+c instead of terminating single mvnw execution
+
+maven="${BASH_SOURCE%/*}/../../mvnw"
+MAVEN_RUN_TESTS="${maven} clean test -Dair.check.skip-all=true -Dmaven.javadoc.skip=true -Dmaven.source.skip=true -B -pl presto-test-jdbc-compatibility"
+
+"${maven}" -version
+
+current_version=$(${maven} help:evaluate -Dexpression=project.version -q -DforceStdout)
+previous_released_version=$((${current_version%-SNAPSHOT}-1))
+first_tested_version=312
+
+echo "Current version: ${current_version}"
+echo "Testing every 3rd version between ${first_tested_version} and ${previous_released_version}"
+
+versions=$(seq "${first_tested_version}" "${previous_released_version}")
+
+exit_code=0
+failed_versions=()
+
+for version in ${versions[*]}; do
+    # Test every third version
+    if ! (( $version % 3 )); then
+        if ! PRESTO_JDBC_VERSION="${version}" time ${MAVEN_RUN_TESTS} -Ddep.presto-jdbc-under-test="${version}"; then
+            exit_code=1
+            failed_versions+=("${version}")
+        fi
+    fi
+done
+
+echo "$0: exiting with ${exit_code}, failed versions: ${failed_versions[@]+\"${failed_versions[@]}\"}"

btw before the change my intellij shows an error on this line
Argument mixes string and array. Use * or separate argument.

replies.bodyText: because the empty array is treated as uninitialized variable and errors... that's a trick to avoid that

Move this to initialization of the versions:
tested_versions=$(seq "${first_tested_version}" 3 "${previous_released_version}")

Also, we should also test previous_released_version:
if (( (previous_released_version - first_tested_version) % 3 != 0 )); then
    tested_versions="${tested_versions}" ${previous_released_version}"
fi 

Also 3 could be a constant for readability (step?)

timeline.bodyText:
Having 2 different values like this looks like we have a bug (which we do not have).
Let's derived one from the other
Timestamp expected = new Timestamp(LocalDateTime.parse(timestamp)
                .atZone(ZoneId.of(TESTED_TZ))
                .toInstant().toEpochMilli());

-#!/bin/bash
+#!/usr/bin/env bash

-MAVEN_RUN_TESTS="${maven} clean test -Dair.check.skip-all=true -Dmaven.javadoc.skip=true -Dmaven.source.skip=true -B -pl presto-test-jdbc-compatibility"
+maven_run_tests="${maven} clean test -Dair.check.skip-all=true -Dmaven.javadoc.skip=true -Dmaven.source.skip=true -B -pl presto-test-jdbc-compatibility"
 
 "${maven}" -version
 
 current_version=$(${maven} help:evaluate -Dexpression=project.version -q -DforceStdout)
 previous_released_version=$((${current_version%-SNAPSHOT}-1))
 first_tested_version=312
+# test n-th version only
+version_step=3

-echo "Testing every 3rd version between ${first_tested_version} and ${previous_released_version}"
+echo "Testing every ${version_step}. version between ${first_tested_version} and ${previous_released_version}"
 
-versions=$(seq "${first_tested_version}" "${previous_released_version}")
+tested_versions=$(seq "${first_tested_version}" ${version_step} "${previous_released_version}")
+
+if (( (previous_released_version - first_tested_version) % 3 != 0 )); then
